It has a smooth surface and is a solid, three-dimensional shape. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector (0.1125, 0.0, 0.3). 2. Start by drawing a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Draw a circle using the center point (0.1875, 0.1875) and radius 0.1875 to create a single face. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.375. 5. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.3 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction. Part 2: Parallel Cylinders with a Rectangular Prism The second part consists of two parallel cylinders with a rectangular prism in between. The rods are of equal length and the prism is half the length of each rod. The rods are connected to the prism at one end. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector (0.3, 0.1781, 0.1031). 2. Start by drawing a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Draw two circles with the same center point (0.0094, 0.0094) and radius 0.0094 to create the first face (face_1), and another circle with center point (0.0094, 0.3844) and radius 0.0094 to create the second face (face_2). 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3938. 5. Extrude both faces separately along the Z-axis by 0.45 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction. Part 3: Cylindrical Rods with a Rectangular Prism The third part consists of two cylindrical rods with a rectangular prism in between. The rods are parallel and the prism is centrally located between them. The rods are of equal length and the prism is half the length of each rod. 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2438. 5. Extrude the first face along the Z-axis by 0.0 units towards the normal and 0.3 units in the opposite direction, and extrude the second face along the Z-axis by 0.3 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction.</description>
